params.taskDescription:
If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math> is the event “number of heads is 20 or fewer”, describe the event <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <msup>
    <mi>E</mi>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi class="MJX-variant" mathvariant="normal">′<!-- ′ --></mi>
    </mrow>
  </msup>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E^{\prime}</annotation></semantics></math> using an inequality.
params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>number of heads</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>></mo>
  <mn>20</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{number of heads}} > 20</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
Find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <msup>
    <mi>E</mi>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi class="MJX-variant" mathvariant="normal">′<!-- ′ --></mi>
    </mrow>
  </msup>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">P(E^{\prime} )</annotation></semantics></math>.

questionSetStimulus: If you flip a fair coin 50 times, the probability of getting 20 or fewer heads is about 10.1% (a fact we’ll learn how to verify later).
